sentences.sContent: ...You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre...
...in line with past experience capital expenditure in the oil sector has dropped sharply in many producing countries...
...Answer Street 2 with a single line through the centre...
...the incoming Fed chief will have to walk a fine line in slowly ending the stimulus...
...People whose levels of happiness and meaning line up...
...a separate line of research by economists has shown that both boys and girls exhibit greater cognitive growth over the school year based on the "dose" of girls in a classroom...
...the sociologist Ruth Milkman of City University of New York found that many line workers...
...that these extracurricular jobs were an effort on the part of the workers to regain their dignity after suffering the degradation of repetitive assembly line work in the factory...

trans.tranOther: to sew a piece of material onto the inside or back of another piece to make it stronger or warmer
